messages.message:
Ive been trying to run some super old containers (~last october) to try and debug some issues for SC. I finally have almost everything up and running, but am getting this error everytime i run a flow:
```[2020-05-11 21:48:31,759: ERROR/MainProcess] Process 'ForkPoolWorker-4' pid:142 exited with 'signal 9 (SIGKILL)'
[2020-05-11 21:48:31,979: ERROR/MainProcess] Chord callback for '6b148eab-d75a-4303-875c-92286f6d3f9b' raised: ChordError(u"Dependency 3b253542-d732-49f3-a003-8a2f9881a89e raised WorkerLostError('Worker exited prematurely: signal 9 (SIGKILL).',)",)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/ibuser/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/celery/backends/redis.py", line 368, in on_chord_part_return
    callback.delay([unpack(tup, decode) for tup in resl])
  File "/home/ibuser/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/celery/backends/redis.py", line 323, in _unpack_chord_result
    raise ChordError('Dependency {0} raised {1!r}'.format(tid, retval))
ChordError: Dependency 3b253542-d732-49f3-a003-8a2f9881a89e raised WorkerLostError('Worker exited prematurely: signal 9 (SIGKILL).',)
[2020-05-11 21:48:32,019: ERROR/MainProcess] Task handler raised error: WorkerLostError('Worker exited prematurely: signal 9 (SIGKILL).',)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/ibuser/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/billiard/pool.py", line 1223, in mark_as_worker_lost
    human_status(exitcode)),
WorkerLostError: Worker exited prematurely: signal 9 (SIGKILL).```
Anyone have an idea what is going on? Seems to be some issue with the python2 redis client?
signal 9 is usually issued when you donâ€™t have enough memory to run the app-tasks.
im running the docker container with 4g of memory tho, seems like it should be enough...
